info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Perquimans, northeastern Bertie and Chowan Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockyhock to near Valhalla to 7 miles southwest of Colerain. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hertford, Rockyhock, Cape Colony, Snug Harbor, Burgess, Valhalla, Midway, Askewville, Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Holiday Island, Drummond Point, Saint Johns, Mount Gould, Hancock, Yeopim Station, Light Nixon Fork, Harvey Point, Buena Vista and Somerset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
